fact: A group of owls is called a parliament.
Some cats are allergic to humans.
The unicorn is the national animal of Scotland.
Sharks can live for 500 years.
An adult human body contains about 100 trillion cells.
The first human-made object to reach space was a dog, Laika, aboard Sputnik 2 in 1957.
A single bolt of lightning contains enough energy to cook 100,000 slices of toast.
A jiffy is an actual unit of time, equivalent to 1/100th of a second.
The heart of a blue whale is as big as a small car.
Butterflies can taste with their feet.
The average person walks the equivalent of five times around the world in a lifetime.
Bananas are naturally radioactive.
The longest-living insect is the termite queen, which can live for over 50 years.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. It lasted 38 minutes.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance.'
A group of pugs is called a 'grumble.'
Polar bears have black skin under their white fur.
The longest word in the English language is pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis.
Wombats have cube-shaped poop to prevent it from rolling away.
There’s a species of jellyfish known as Turritopsis dohrnii that is biologically immortal.
The world's largest snowflake on record was 15 inches wide and 8 inches thick.
It rains diamonds on Jupiter and Saturn.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient tombs that are over 3,000 years old.
Cows have best friends and can become stressed when separated.
A shrimp’s heart is located in its head.
A banana is technically a berry, but a strawberry is not.
A cat’s nose is as unique as a human’s fingerprint.
Polar bear fur is transparent, not white.
A crocodile cannot stick its tongue out.
A newborn kangaroo is the size of a lima bean.
Bamboo can grow up to 35 inches in a single day.
The longest hiccuping spree lasted 68 years.
Sharks are older than trees, having existed for over 400 million years.
The shortest commercial flight in the world lasts only 57 seconds, between two islands in Scotland.
The world’s largest desert is not the Sahara, but Antarctica.
Dolphins have names for each other and can call out to each other using unique whistles.
The first alarm clock could only ring at 4 a.m.
A starfish has no brain, heart, or blood.
Cows can walk upstairs, but they can't walk downstairs.
An octopus has three hearts and blue blood.
The longest hiccuping streak in history lasted for 68 years.
The smallest bone in the human body is in the ear and is called the stapes bone.
Dolphins can sleep with one eye open.
The shortest war in history lasted 38 minutes.
Sloths can hold their breath for up to 40 minutes underwater.
In Japan, the word for ‘crisis’ and ‘opportunity’ is the same.
An elephant’s trunk has more than 40,000 muscles.
An ostrich's eye is bigger than its brain.
Some species of frogs can freeze themselves during winter and thaw out in the spring.
The longest living organism on Earth is a species of fungus in Oregon that is thousands of years old.
A jellyfish’s body is about 95% water.
A baby octopus is the size of a pea when it is born.
A single strand of human hair can support up to 100 grams of weight.
It is possible to turn peanut butter into diamonds by subjecting it to extreme pressure.
Horses can’t vomit.
The only letter that doesn’t appear in any U.S. state name is the letter Q.
The human eye can distinguish approximately 10 million different colors.
A giraffe’s neck contains the same number of vertebrae as a human's neck.
The longest fingernails on one hand ever recorded were 28 feet 4.5 inches long.
A panda’s diet is almost exclusively bamboo.
A full moon is nine times brighter than a half moon.
You can’t hum while holding your nose.
A duck’s quack doesn’t echo.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on all of Earth's beaches.
A cloud can weigh more than a million pounds.
The longest word in the dictionary is the name of a protein called Titin.
The average person has 70,000 thoughts a day.
Sharks have been around for over 400 million years.
A blue whale’s heart weighs as much as a car.
The human body contains enough fat to make seven bars of soap.
The first computer virus was created in 1983.
A starfish can regenerate its limbs if they are lost.
Elephants are the only mammals that can't jump.
The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer due to the expansion of iron in the heat.
A single teaspoon of honey represents the life work of 12 bees.
The longest hiccuping spree lasted for 68 years.
Rats laugh when they are tickled.
You can’t tickle yourself because your brain knows what to expect.
The human nose can detect over 1 trillion different smells.
Butterflies can taste with their feet.
The Eiffel Tower is 15 cm taller in the summer due to the heat expansion of metal.
A hummingbird’s heart can beat up to 1,200 times per minute.
Some species of jellyfish are immortal.
A giraffe's tongue is about 18-20 inches long.
An octopus has three hearts, two to pump blood to the gills and one to pump blood to the rest of the body.
A cockroach can live for several weeks without its head.
The first alarm clock could only ring at 4 a.m.
A newborn kangaroo is the size of a lima bean.
